info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 1:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN SANTA FE COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM MDT... At 115 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near La Cienega, or 7 miles west of Santa Fe, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. This storm has a history of producing nickel and dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Fe, Hyde Memorial State Park, Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, Tesuque, Chupadero, Agua Fria and La Cienega. This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 277 and 286. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
